net.tomp2p.dht

Interface OperationMapper<K extends FutureDHT<?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - The type of the future that takes care of all the RPC futures

    public interface OperationMapper<K extends FutureDHT<?>>
    The operations that create many RPC.
    Author:
    Thomas Bocek

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FutureResponse create(ChannelCreator channelCreator, PeerAddress remotePeerAddress)
      Creates a single RPC.
      void interMediateResponse(FutureResponse futureResponse)
      Whenever a single future is finished, then this method is called.
      void response(K future, FutureDone<Void> futuresCompleted)
      If the response over all futures arrived (all that were created with create(ChannelCreator, PeerAddress) ).

    • Method Detail

      • create

        FutureResponse create(ChannelCreator channelCreator,
                      PeerAddress remotePeerAddress)
        Creates a single RPC.
        Parameters:
        channelCreator - The channel creator to creade a UDP or TCP channel
        remotePeerAddress - The address of the remote peer
        Returns:
        The future object of this response

      • response

        void response(K future,
              FutureDone<Void> futuresCompleted)
        If the response over all futures arrived (all that were created with create(ChannelCreator, PeerAddress) ).
        Parameters:
        future - The overall future, typically FutureDHT or similar

      • interMediateResponse

        void interMediateResponse(FutureResponse futureResponse)
        Whenever a single future is finished, then this method is called.
        Parameters:
        futureResponse - The future object from an RPC
